clinical_study.brief_title: The Trauma of Betrayal: Treating Adjustment Disorder With Reconsolidation Blockade Under Propranolol
clinical_study.official_title: Treating Adjustment Disorders Stemming From Romantic Betrayals: An Open-label Trial of Impairing Memory Reconsolidation Using Propranolol

brief_summary.textblock: Attachment injuries are events occurring within couple relationships that involve betrayal or abandonment by a significant other during times of need (e.g., infidelity). They can be understood as relationship traumas, which can lead to debilitating symptoms consistent with posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), depression, and generalized anxiety for the injured partner. Research has demonstrated that the presence of an attachment injury represents a barrier to empirically effective couple's therapy. However, disrupting memory reconsolidation with the beta-blocker propranolol has been shown to alleviate PTSD symptoms by attenuating the salience of the emotional trauma memory, representing an interesting avenue for the treatment of adjustment disorders stemming from attachment injuries. Here, the investigators aim to extend the conditions under which reconsolidation therapy with propranolol can be used in a clinical setting. The investigators hypothesize that, compared to a wait-list control, 4-6 sessions of memory reactivation under propranolol would significantly reduce trauma-related, depression, and anxiety symptom, associated with an attachment injury.

study_design_info.masking_description: Randomization to 'waitlist group' or 'treatment group' will be done by a blind investigator at the time of the statistical analyses. The randomization scheme will use the permuted-block method with a block size of four, stratified by gender (male and female) and event type (infidelity and other), and a group allocation probability of 50% (Fleiss, 1986). A sensitivity analysis will be conducted by via a cross-over method, whereby the group allocation will be reversed, and all outcome data will be re-analyzed.

primary_outcome.measure: Between group difference: Wait-list vs. Treatment on Impact of Events Scale-Revised Scores
primary_outcome.time_frame: Administered at baseline (Week 0), Post-Wait-list (Week 4), at each subsequent weekly visit, at the one-week post-treatment follow-up, and at the three-month follow up.
primary_outcome.description: Severity of Trauma and Stressor-related symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: Between group difference: Wait-list vs. Treatment on Hopkins Symptom Checklist-25
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Administered at baseline (Week 0), Post-Wait-list (Week 4), at each subsequent weekly visit, at the one-week post-treatment follow-up, and at the three-month follow up.

secondary_outcome.measure: Between group difference: Wait-list vs. Treatment on World Health Organization - Quality of Life BREF
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Administered at baseline (Week 0), Post-Wait-list (Week 4), at the one-week post-treatment follow-up, and at the three-month follow up.
secondary_outcome.description: Perceived Quality of Life in 4 Domains, Psychological, Physical, Environmental, Social

intervention.description: 1mg/kg of propranolol 60 minutes prior to memory reactivation
